Course Description: This course will give an understanding of public health information systems. It will include key concepts of public health, sources of public health information, ethics in public health practice and research, and an understanding of various public health information systems in use.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Understand the scope and concerns of public health
Course Outcomes.CO2: Appreciate the subtleties of the varied forms of information about the health of a population and related matters
Course Outcomes.CO3: Understand the existing use of information systems in support of public health
Course Outcomes.CO4: Understand the role of ethics in public health

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Scope and Concerns of Public Health
Priority Health Metrics (Indicators of Sustainable Development Goals)
Historical perspective of information systems in public health
Information systems in support of public health in high-income countries-1
Information systems in support of public health in high-income countries-2
Information systems in support of public health in low and middle-income countries-1
Information systems in support of public health in low and middle-income countries-2
New communication technologies, social media & public health
Key ethical issues in public health research

Resource Material.Textbook: Oxford Textbook of Global Public Health (2015)
